sentences.sentence: The flip side of the coin for Kyiv has been the success in driving Russian troops off Snake Island, an important staging ground for possible attacks on Ukrainian territory including Odessa the concentration of the war in the Donbass is having the desired effect for Vladimir Putin who is gradually gaining the ground that his separatist followers in the region have been unable to gain in years of war four months into the invasion it's still impossible to know how far Putin wants to go.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Charles Michel, the European Council president, and the Czech Prime Minister Petra Fiala met in Prague to preview the first steps to the EU's rotating presidency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Czech Republic will deepen cooperation with like-minded countries during its six-month term, just like France did in the first half of the year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We have agreed to hold an extraordinary European Council during our presidency, which will take place in Prague in October, and we have also talked about the Wider Europe project, where we would create a platform for all democratically-minded European countries to meet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: During the NATO summit in Madrid, President Emmanuel Macron symbolically handed over the button to the Czech leaders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But certainly one of the main issues that Prague is inheriting is the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The biggest challenge facing Europe since the end of World War II, the soon-to-be Czech presidency will have to look for solutions for the economic impacts created by the conflict so far.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Today the Czech Republic is taking over the EU Council's rotating presidency from France, and Prague aims to boost the EU's reaction to the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The EU's rotating presidency means that the diplomats and politicians of that country will chair European Council meetings and take the lead on issues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And this normally gives the country a unique chance to influence policies and decision-making of the bloc.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Czech presidency program has five points and basically concentrates on how the EU could tackle the crisis provoked by Russia's invasion in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: They want to mitigate the effects of the migration wave, enhance defence cooperation in order to gain more independence for Europe from the United States.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: At the same time, Prague would like to cut the bloc's dependence on Russian energy, as the continent faces major gas shortages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: On this topic, I asked the European Commission's Czech Vice President, Vera Jourova.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We will have to take the proper decisions, not to hurt us more than Russia by the sanctions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And we have to stay united in the resolute reactions on the aggression, and at the same time apply reasonable and well thought through politics and decisions which will ease the situation for Europeans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Because indeed we want maybe too much from the people now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Presiding over European Council meetings is always an interesting and appealing task for smaller member states, but this time there is a big factor of uncertainty because of the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: For the moment, no one knows whether or not we are heading towards a ceasefire or an escalation in Ukraine.
